but didn't know what to make of it. I'm looking at <https://juliamanifolds.github.io/Manifolds.jl/latest/features/distributions.html> but can honestly say I have no idea if it's applicable to my example or not :flushed:

attachments.title: [RFC] Taking directional/orientational statistics seriously
attachments.text: To my knowledge, there are no Julia packages with good support for directional and orientational statistics. Directional statistics is used in biology (especially structural biology), crystallography, astronomy, and various other physics applications including geophysics. Distributions.jl implements VonMises for circular variables (angles) and VonMisesFisher for spherical variables (unit vectors), but that’s it. No orientational distributions are implemented.
